amendment.description: Amendment sought to make an exemption to the REINS Act to ensure that policies that protect children from cancer, premature death, asthma attacks, or respiratory disease are not delayed or denied.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 4 printed in House Report 115-1 to ensure any rule that will result in reduced incidence of cancer, premature mortality, asthma attacks, or respiratory disease in children is not considered a "major rule".

vote.text: On agreeing to the Castor (FL) amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 190 - 233 (Roll no. 14).

action.text: Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Castor (FL) amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 190 - 233 (Roll no. 14).
House amendment offered/reported by : Amendment (A004) offered by Ms. Castor (FL).
